values.description:
Fix tests on Windows. There is still a problem with unloading the rendering engine plugin on Windows. I added an `#ifndef` for windows and ticketed issue #46.

Here’s a [windows build](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_rendering-pr-win/213) with the fix. The number of test failures reduced from [32](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_rendering-pr-win/211) to 3
values.title: Fix tests on Windows

summary.raw:
Fix tests on Windows. There is still a problem with unloading the rendering engine plugin on Windows. I added an `#ifndef` for windows and ticketed issue #46.

Here’s a [windows build](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_rendering-pr-win/213) with the fix. The number of test failures reduced from [32](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_rendering-pr-win/211) to 3

values.description:
Add support for render passes. A render pass can be thought of as a \(post-processing\) effect that can be applied to the rendered output of a camera.

Render passes can be chained, meaning that a series of effects can be applied over one another in the order in which they are added.

An ogre1.x version of the Gaussian noise implementation is ported from gazebo, and a `render_pass` example is added in the examples folder to demonstrate this effect, see screenshot:

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/zq9ear/images/2517435151-gaussian_noise.png)
values.title: Add support for Render Passes and implement Gaussian Noise pass

summary.raw:
Add support for render passes. A render pass can be thought of as a \(post-processing\) effect that can be applied to the rendered output of a camera.

Render passes can be chained, meaning that a series of effects can be applied over one another in the order in which they are added.

An ogre1.x version of the Gaussian noise implementation is ported from gazebo, and a `render_pass` example is added in the examples folder to demonstrate this effect, see screenshot:

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/zq9ear/images/2517435151-gaussian_noise.png)
summary.html:
Add support for render passes. A render pass can be thought of as a (post-processing) effect that can be applied to the rendered output of a camera.

Render passes can be chained, meaning that a series of effects can be applied over one another in the order in which they are added.

An ogre1.x version of the Gaussian noise implementation is ported from gazebo, and a render_pass example is added in the examples folder to demonstrate this effect, see screenshot:

values.description:
Depends on pull request #154

Added ogre2 implementation of RenderPass and GaussianNoisePass. Also added API to enable/disable render passes.

Updated `ogre2_demo` to demonstrate this feature. Press `p` to toggle the Gaussian noise render pass on and off. Here’s a screenshot of the demo with the Gaussian noise render pass enabled:

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/zq9ear/images/780767410-gaussian_noise_ogre2_updated.png)
‌

To run ogre2 tests:

```
RENDER_ENGINE_VALUES=ogre2 make test
```
values.title: Add Ogre2 Gaussian noise render pass

summary.raw:
Depends on pull request #154

Added ogre2 implementation of RenderPass and GaussianNoisePass. Also added API to enable/disable render passes.

Updated `ogre2_demo` to demonstrate this feature. Press `p` to toggle the Gaussian noise render pass on and off. Here’s a screenshot of the demo with the Gaussian noise render pass enabled:

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/zq9ear/images/780767410-gaussian_noise_ogre2_updated.png)
‌

To run ogre2 tests:

```
RENDER_ENGINE_VALUES=ogre2 make test
```
summary.html:
Depends on pull request #154

Added ogre2 implementation of RenderPass and GaussianNoisePass. Also added API to enable/disable render passes.

Updated ogre2_demo to demonstrate this feature. Press p to toggle the Gaussian noise render pass on and off. Here’s a screenshot of the demo with the Gaussian noise render pass enabled:

‌

To run ogre2 tests:

RENDER_ENGINE_VALUES=ogre2 make test

values.description:
The GizmoVisual class contains visuals for translating, rotating, and scaling nodes.

The user can set the TransformMode of the GizmoVisual. Once a mode is set, the relevant transform visual will be displayed, e.g. when set to translation mode, the three RGB axis visuals will be displayed; when set to rotation mode, the three RGB circles will be shown instead.

GizmoVisual is used by the TransformController class in pull request #162
values.title: Add GizmoVisual class

summary.raw:
The GizmoVisual class contains visuals for translating, rotating, and scaling nodes.

The user can set the TransformMode of the GizmoVisual. Once a mode is set, the relevant transform visual will be displayed, e.g. when set to translation mode, the three RGB axis visuals will be displayed; when set to rotation mode, the three RGB circles will be shown instead.

GizmoVisual is used by the TransformController class in pull request #162
summary.html:
The GizmoVisual class contains visuals for translating, rotating, and scaling nodes.

The user can set the TransformMode of the GizmoVisual. Once a mode is set, the relevant transform visual will be displayed, e.g. when set to translation mode, the three RGB axis visuals will be displayed; when set to rotation mode, the three RGB circles will be shown instead.

GizmoVisual is used by the TransformController class in pull request #162

values.description: Previously if the GizmoVisual is rendered over an object, it may not get picked by the mouse when using ogre2 render engine. The changes added in Ogre2Material.cc are similar to [those](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/src/bd0133a7283307cd829ffe2254cb7e5fd1daa9b1/ogre/src/OgreMaterialSwitcher.cc#lines-89) in the ogre1.x implementation, where the mouse picking camera will now take into account the depth write/check properties of material.
values.title: Ogre2: Support mouse picking for objects with overlay material

summary.raw: Previously if the GizmoVisual is rendered over an object, it may not get picked by the mouse when using ogre2 render engine. The changes added in Ogre2Material.cc are similar to [those](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/src/bd0133a7283307cd829ffe2254cb7e5fd1daa9b1/ogre/src/OgreMaterialSwitcher.cc#lines-89) in the ogre1.x implementation, where the mouse picking camera will now take into account the depth write/check properties of material.
summary.html: Previously if the GizmoVisual is rendered over an object, it may not get picked by the mouse when using ogre2 render engine. The changes added in Ogre2Material.cc are similar to those in the ogre1.x implementation, where the mouse picking camera will now take into account the depth write/check properties of material.

values.description:
While working on ogre2 for Windows \(the cmake file use the same variables names than ogre1\) I noted that we are using an unneeded `include_directive`. The includes are being exported by FindIgnOGRE module interface in ign-cmake. Do not need to add them more times.

Tested \(with both ogre1 and ogre2\):

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign_rendering-pr-win&build=334)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign\_rendering-pr-win/334/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_rendering-pr-win/334/))
values.title: Remove spurious include_directories directive

summary.raw:
While working on ogre2 for Windows \(the cmake file use the same variables names than ogre1\) I noted that we are using an unneeded `include_directive`. The includes are being exported by FindIgnOGRE module interface in ign-cmake. Do not need to add them more times.

Tested \(with both ogre1 and ogre2\):

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign_rendering-pr-win&build=334)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign\_rendering-pr-win/334/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_rendering-pr-win/334/))
summary.html:
While working on ogre2 for Windows (the cmake file use the same variables names than ogre1) I noted that we are using an unneeded include_directive. The includes are being exported by FindIgnOGRE module interface in ign-cmake. Do not need to add them more times.

Tested (with both ogre1 and ogre2):

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_rendering-pr-win/334/)

values.description:
Fixes the field of view of the ogre2 implementation of DepthCamera. The RGB and depth data should now be aligned. 

Also updated depth camera test to position the box just within the FOV of the camera. The test checks that the depth camera can still see the background at left and right edges of the depth image. Without this change, the depth camera will have a narrower FOV, causing the depth test to fail. To run the test with ogre2, exec the cmd below from your build directory:

```
RENDER_ENGINE_VALUES=ogre2 ./bin/INTEGRATION_depth_camera
```

Here’s a screenshot in rviz showing that the rgb camera data are now aligned with depth data:

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/zq9ear/images/2708520897-Screenshot_from_2019-06-20_14-10-26.png)
values.title: Fix ogre2 DepthCamera FOV

summary.raw:

Also updated depth camera test to position the box just within the FOV of the camera. The test checks that the depth camera can still see the background at left and right edges of the depth image. Without this change, the depth camera will have a narrower FOV, causing the depth test to fail. To run the test with ogre2, exec the cmd below from your build directory:


Also updated depth camera test to position the box just within the FOV of the camera. The test checks that the depth camera can still see the background at left and right edges of the depth image. Without this change, the depth camera will have a narrower FOV, causing the depth test to fail. To run the test with ogre2, exec the cmd below from your build directory:

Here’s a screenshot in rviz showing that the rgb camera data are now aligned with depth data:

values.description:
This PR, together with the PR in ign-common, adds support for Actor simulation. Basically, it adds the follows:

* An example to show how to load the Actor and its animation: `actor_animation`
* Three functions in `Mesh.cc`:

    * `HasSkeleton`: check whether the mesh has a skeleton structure
    * `SkeletonLocalTransforms`: get the local transformations of the skeleton nodes
    * `SetSkeletonLocalTransforms`: set the local transformations of the skeleton nodes
    
* Implement the above three functions for Ogre
values.title: Add support for playing Actor animation

summary.raw:
This PR, together with the PR in ign-common, adds support for Actor simulation. Basically, it adds the follows:

* An example to show how to load the Actor and its animation: `actor_animation`
* Three functions in `Mesh.cc`:

    * `HasSkeleton`: check whether the mesh has a skeleton structure
    * `SkeletonLocalTransforms`: get the local transformations of the skeleton nodes
    * `SetSkeletonLocalTransforms`: set the local transformations of the skeleton nodes
    
* Implement the above three functions for Ogre
summary.html:

    • SetSkeletonLocalTransforms: set the local transformations of the skeleton nodes

  • Implement the above three functions for Ogre

values.description:
Add 3 functions in `Mesh` class:

* `HasSkeleton`: whether the `Mesh` has a skeletal structure associated with it
* `SkeletonLocalTransforms`: get the local transformations of the mesh skeleton
* `SetSkeletonLocalTransforms`: set the local transformations of the mesh skeleton

Also, implemented the above three functions in Ogre

An example is also added to `examples/actor_animation`. The outcome is as follows:

* Colloda animation

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/kkkpAkp/images/3559310707-dae_motion.gif)
* BVH animation

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/kkkpAkp/images/3670517481-bvh_motion.gif)
values.title: add animation api for mesh and examples to show the function

values.description:
Fixed a memory leak that happens when the user clicks on one the axes in the transform control tool.

When this happens, the axis that's selected is set as active and assigned the 'active' material.  However, the `SetMaterial` call is requesting the 'active' material to be cloned before assign it to the axis visual, i.e. a new material will be created. This can be avoided by passing `false` as the second argument to the `SetMaterial` function
values.title: Fix GizmoVisual material memory leak

summary.raw:
Fixed a memory leak that happens when the user clicks on one the axes in the transform control tool.

When this happens, the axis that's selected is set as active and assigned the 'active' material.  However, the `SetMaterial` call is requesting the 'active' material to be cloned before assign it to the axis visual, i.e. a new material will be created. This can be avoided by passing `false` as the second argument to the `SetMaterial` function
summary.html:
Fixed a memory leak that happens when the user clicks on one the axes in the transform control tool.

When this happens, the axis that's selected is set as active and assigned the 'active' material. However, the SetMaterial call is requesting the 'active' material to be cloned before assign it to the axis visual, i.e. a new material will be created. This can be avoided by passing false as the second argument to the SetMaterial function

values.description: The byte and channel count for the 3 `FLOAT32` typed format were all incorrect. This affects functions like `PixelUtil::MemorySize`, which is used to compute the amount of memory that needs to be allocated to store data.
values.title: Fix PixelFormat FLOAT32 byte and channel count

summary.raw: The byte and channel count for the 3 `FLOAT32` typed format were all incorrect. This affects functions like `PixelUtil::MemorySize`, which is used to compute the amount of memory that needs to be allocated to store data.
summary.html: The byte and channel count for the 3 FLOAT32 typed format were all incorrect. This affects functions like PixelUtil::MemorySize, which is used to compute the amount of memory that needs to be allocated to store data.

values.description:
Updated ogre1.x and ogre 2.1 implementation to generate XYZ RGB point clouds in addition to depth.

The original implementation generated depth data in shaders and pack the result in a single channel 32 bit float texture. This is now changed to a four channel 32 bit float texture which packs `[x, y, z, rgba]` data. Note the last `rgba` field is encoded by four 8 bit r, g, b, a values. With these four fields, we can populate the point cloud msg with XYZ and RGB data, as well as color and depth image msgs.

While working on the ogre2 implementation, I found a major bug with the depth data values. The data generated are actually ‘range’ not ‘depth’. It’s now fixed.

See below for a results produced by a RgbdCameraSensor \(which uses ign-rendering DepthCamera\).

**Before**: notice the curved lines on the ground and the jersey barrier is rotated

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/zq9ear/images/1071464591-pointCloud_before.png)
‌

**After**: The lines are now straight and the jersey barrier orientation is correct.

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/zq9ear/images/3672754229-pointCloud_after.png)
values.title: Support generating point cloud data in DepthCamera

summary.raw:
Updated ogre1.x and ogre 2.1 implementation to generate XYZ RGB point clouds in addition to depth.

The original implementation generated depth data in shaders and pack the result in a single channel 32 bit float texture. This is now changed to a four channel 32 bit float texture which packs `[x, y, z, rgba]` data. Note the last `rgba` field is encoded by four 8 bit r, g, b, a values. With these four fields, we can populate the point cloud msg with XYZ and RGB data, as well as color and depth image msgs.

While working on the ogre2 implementation, I found a major bug with the depth data values. The data generated are actually ‘range’ not ‘depth’. It’s now fixed.

See below for a results produced by a RgbdCameraSensor \(which uses ign-rendering DepthCamera\).

**Before**: notice the curved lines on the ground and the jersey barrier is rotated

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/zq9ear/images/1071464591-pointCloud_before.png)
‌

**After**: The lines are now straight and the jersey barrier orientation is correct.

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/zq9ear/images/3672754229-pointCloud_after.png)
summary.html:
Updated ogre1.x and ogre 2.1 implementation to generate XYZ RGB point clouds in addition to depth.

The original implementation generated depth data in shaders and pack the result in a single channel 32 bit float texture. This is now changed to a four channel 32 bit float texture which packs [x, y, z, rgba] data. Note the last rgba field is encoded by four 8 bit r, g, b, a values. With these four fields, we can populate the point cloud msg with XYZ and RGB data, as well as color and depth image msgs.

While working on the ogre2 implementation, I found a major bug with the depth data values. The data generated are actually ‘range’ not ‘depth’. It’s now fixed.

See below for a results produced by a RgbdCameraSensor (which uses ign-rendering DepthCamera).

Before: notice the curved lines on the ground and the jersey barrier is rotated

‌

After: The lines are now straight and the jersey barrier orientation is correct.

values.title: Bump to 2.1.1

values.description:
[subt issue #173](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/subt/issues/173/color-compression-on-image_raw-images)

Without this, discretization appears in the distribution of color values.

To test with subt,

* launch a robot with an rgbd camera, e.g. X3 config 3,
* save an image from the rgbd camera topic using rqt\_image\_viewer,
* open the image with gimp
* From the top toolbar menu: Color → Levels
* Verify that the histogram of color values is smooth

**Before**

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/zq9ear/images/1400858840-x3_3_before.png)
‌

**After**

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/zq9ear/images/1811353717-x3_3_after.png)
values.title: Enable gamma write on color texture in depth camera

Currently only these primitive types are supported: `int`, `float`, `double`, and `string`
